result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program - NOT eligible until first 10 years is served.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program - NOT eligible until first 10 years is served.
Apply 218 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: present revocation sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid in the following order:  $500 for the deductible to be paid to the BP Gas Station and $800 to the Insurance Company.  Restitution to be paid out of any prison wages as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268), DNA surcharge ($250) and Extradition Fee ($1,870) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint - D.M. and the BP Gas Station on Beloit Road or the co-actor.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 25 Years.
Initial Confinement:  15 Years.
Extended Supervision:  10 Years.
218 Days Credit.
Concurrent to present revocation sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint - D.M. and the BP Gas Station on Beloit Road or the Co-Actor.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION:  $3,170 (Breakdown:  $1,870 for Extradition to be paid to the Waukesha County D.A.'s Office, $500 for the deductable to be paid to the BP Gas Stations and $800 to be paid to the insurance company) - to be paid out of any prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision (restitution to be paid first in the following order:  $500, $800, $1,870 then any costs).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program - Not eligble until first 10 years is served.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program - Not eligble until first 10 years is served.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

  

Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
Pending Sentencing - Per Judge Dreyfus.
Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.

From Jury Trial Held on 05/19/15 - 05/20/15.
(3) Notes sent out by the jurors.

Jury Trial - Day Two
Continued from:  05/19/15
Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.   

Court on the record @ 9:05 a.m.
Court and the parties issues outside the presences of the jurors.
Court addressed with the parties jury instruction 158 being read to the jurors prior to an audio - DVD being played.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:19 a.m.

Witness Called: Jose Armando Degro Reyes (Defendant)
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Court read Jury Instruction 158 to the jurors.
State played the audio of the phone interview with Detective Schmit and the defendant.

Defense Rests.
State will be calling two rebuttal witnesses.

Jurors excused for brief recess @ 9:41 a.m.
Court in brief adjournment @ 9:42 a.m.
Court back on the record @ 9:50 a.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:51 a.m.

Rebuttal Witnesses Called: Jayson Vanderveer (Co-Actor) and Detective Scott Schmit (City of New Berlin P.D.)
Rebuttal Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Exhibit Offered and Received:  34.
Exhibits 24 - 27 & 29 - 31 never offered or received - Returned to the proffering party.
Exhibit 33 - Black Hooded Sweatshirt - Returned to New Berlin Police for Storage.

Court deems testimony Closed.
Juror excused @ 10:01 a.m.

Atty. Jones moves to dismiss or a directed verdict.
State requests the court deny the motions.
Court is satisfied the State has made a Prima Facia showing.
Therefore, Court denies both defense motions.
Further reasons placed on the record.

Court addressed Jury Instructions and Verdicts with the parties.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 10:38 a.m.

State presented closing statements.
Defense presented closing statements.
State presented rebuttal.
Court read the Jury Instructions and Verdicts to the Jurors.
Bailiff Sworn in @ 11:26 a.m.
Jurors excused for deliberations @ 11:26 a.m.

Court in adjournment @ 11:29 a.m.

Juror sent out 2 notes requesting the photos.
Court reviewed - Request granted - Photos sent back.

Jurors sent out note to listen to exhibit #34.
Both attorneys notified to return to the courtroom.
Court back on the record @ 2:22 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:28 p.m. to listen to the audio tape.
Audio tape played for the jurors.
Jurors excused to continue with deliberations @ 2:39 p.m.

Jurors notified the Bailiff of a verdict @ 2:45 p.m.
Court back on the record @ 2:48 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:49 p.m.
Court read the verdict - GUILTY of armed robbery.
Jurors are polled.
State and Defense have no objections to the polling of the jurors.
Court receives the verdict and enters a verdict of GUILTY.
Bail is revoked pending sentencing.
Jurors are excused for the evening @ 2:56 p.m.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges Strike Sheet.
(2) Voir Dire Lists - One Random and One Alphabetical.

Jury Trial - Day One
Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.   

Court addressed the State and Defense Attorney as to the courtroom procedures.
Court addressed Motions In Limine with the parties.

JAR called @ 09:11 a.m.
Bailiff sent down to bring up the Potential Jurors @ 09:11 a.m.
29 Potential Jurors entered the courtroom @  9:23 a.m.
All parties received a copy of the alphabetical list of potential jurors.
Court addressed all 29 potential jurors.
All potential jurors sworn in @ 9:29 a.m.
Clerk calls the first 20 names off the random list.

Court conducted voir dire.
State conducted voir dire.
Defense conducted voir dire.

State and Defense conduct their strikes.
Clerk reads the 12 Selected Jurors names.
12 Selected Jurors Sworn in.
Court thanked all the jurors.
All non-selected jurors sent back to the JAR @ 10:38 a.m..

Court in brief recess @ 10:40 a.m.
Court back on the record @ 10:57 a.m.

Court addressed scheduling with both parties.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 10:59 a.m.

State presented opening statements.
Defense presented opening statements.
Note pads passed out to the jurors.

Witnesses Called: D. M. (Victim - Clerk from PB Gas Station) and K.S. (Victim - Family Owns the PB Gas Station).
Witnesses sworn and testified.

Jurors excused for Lunch @ 11:39 a.m.
Court in adjournment for Lunch @ 11:44 a.m.

Court back on the record @ 1:06 p.m.

Court addressed issues with both the State and Defense.
Court will order that Mr. Jayson Vandeveer be held pending the conclusion of the jury trial.
Court addressed the issue of plea negotiations coming out in testimony.
Court addressed the issue of plea negotiations with Mr. Vandeveer.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 1:16 p.m.

Witnesses Called:  Jayson Vanderveer (Co-Actor), Christopher Smith (Deputy US Marshall) and Charles Sosinski (Probation and Parole Agent).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for a brief recess @ 2:08 p.m.
Court in a brief recess @ 2:09 p.m.
Court back on the record @ 2:25 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:27 p.m.

Witnesses Called:  Maria Alvarado (Ex-Wife of Defendant) Patrick Ryan Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter for Ms. Alvarado and Detective Scott Schmit (City of New Berlin P.D.).
Witnesses sworn and testified.

Jurors excused for a brief recess @ 3:16 p.m.
Court in a brief adjournment @ 03:20 p.m.

Court back on the record @ 3:43 p.m.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 3:46 p.m.
State Rests.

Witness Called: Nikole Stuck-Hart (Defendant's ex-girlfriend).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused @ 04:02 p.m.

Defendant wants to testify.
Court addressed the defendant's right to testify or not testify.
Court is satisfied the defendant is fully aware of his rights to testify or not testify.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 04:12 p.m.

Witness Called:  Jose Armando Degro Reyes (Defendant).
Witness Sworn and Testified.


Exhibits Marked: 1 -34.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  1 - 23, 28, 32 & 33.
Exhibit #33 was returned to Detective Schmit for storage at the City of New Berlin.

Jurors excused for the evening @ 4:41 p.m.
Court in adjournment for the evening @ 4:46 p.m.
Stipulations document filed by State.

Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jones advised court that the matter will be proceeding to trial. There is a stipulation with the parties regarding certain custodian of records witnesses. Attorney Jones placed defendant's plea offer on the record and the defendant is rejecting the offer. Court orders this matter to proceed to trial on Tuesday, May 19, 2015. State filed stipulation with the Court. Court addressed motions in limine. Court addressed the 5 prior convictions if defendant chooses to testify. State addressed witnesses that are flying in from out of state if trial settles prior to Tuesday. Parties believe trial should take 2 days. Court will not impanel an alternate juror. Trial to start at 8:30am. Court advised Attorney Jones that if defendant chooses to take plea offer prior to trial, then he will need to notify the Clerk's office. Defendant to be provided clothing for trial.
for Witness for Jury Trial on May 19, 2015.
Defendant's parole was revoked and he was given an additional 3 years. Per Beth at the Waukesha County Jail, defendant to remain here in the Waukesha County Jail until his next court date 5/12/15.
with cover letter filed by State.
Patrick Ryan to interpreter for witness, M.A.P. on 5-19-15 and he will be available from 2:00 p.m. through the end of the day.

Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested and 10 day time limit waived until December 8, 2014.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Case recalled at 2:41 p.m. Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski who appeared by telephone.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advised defendant that his case was called earlier and the person who came out said he was Mr. Reyes, therefore, Court had to recall the case. Defendant in court states he is Armando Degro Reyes. Court leaves bail as set and leaves the Preliminary hearing on December 8, 2014 when the codefendant's case is scheduled.

Defendant to have no contact with codefendant/victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Jose Armando Degro Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
